Recent Activity

A simple timeline view of actions that have occured. 

<filamentui-activity activities="activities"></filamentui-activity>

The activities directive can accept a list of items and an option 'action' parameter. The main use of the action is for optional navigation to more detailed activity logs. 


            

            

                The action field can be passed a click function:
            

            
action: {
    "title": 'SHOW ALL',
    "click": function () {
        console.log('I have been clicked');
    }
}

Tabs

        

            

                
                    
                    These are some details
                
            
                
                    
                    This tab is switched!
                
            
            
        

        

            

                Tabs enable a user to swap between views of data. The wrapping tabs container will take the width of the container it is placed in.
            

            
<filamentui-tabs position="'horizontal'">
    <filamentui-tab index="0" name="Details">
        
        These are some details
    </filamentui-tab>

    <filamentui-tab index="1" name="Switch">
        
        This tab is switched!
    </filamentui-tab>
</filamentui-tabs>
            

            

                Currently only a 'horizontal' styling is implemented.

<filamentui-pills ng-model="pill" options="pills" default-index="3"></filamentui-pills>
            

        

    

    

        
Inputs

        

            

                
                
                
                
                

                
                
                
                
                

                
                

                
                

                
                

                
                
 
                
                

            


            

                
            

            
            

                
                
                
                
            

        

        

            

                To use the date picker, specify a date attribute using the following setup: 

            

            

                The 'max' date specifies the maximum date a user may select. 'set' specifies the default selected date. Inputs are returned in the given 'format'. These formats must be valid as per the standard for JavaScript Date Objects.
            

            
<filamentui-input title="'H4 Input Header'" placeholder="'Placeholder text'" ng-model="test.basicInput" valid="isNumber(test.basicInput)"></filamentui-input>

<filamentui-input class="helper" title="'Helper Input'" placeholder="'Enter Text here'" ng-model="test.helpInput" help="displayHelp()"></filamentui-input>

<filamentui-input class="search" title="'No Search Title'" placeholder="'Search Here'" ng-model="test.search"></filamentui-input>

Cards

        
Hub Cards

        

            
        

        

            
        


        

            
            
            
            
            
        

        

            
Hub cards allow for sets of model information to be displayed clearly and are given pagination options by default. They are generally used to display dynamic collections of user driven data. Given this, it is possible to rename the title on the add card to react to different situations and each card displays a button that suggests what the card data is used for. Cards react similarly to buttons when clicked to provide tactile feedback.

Card layouts of this type expect the surrounding page to handle filtering, and for this to be passed into the api that the card set uses to pull the correct data. This is similar to how tables function with the difference that the card container does not have the ability to pass the filtering data into the directive as it does not need to be displayed internally in the same way that a table requires.

By default, cards are expected to be accessed via the wrapper directive 'filamentuiCardContainer'

<filamentui-card-container cards="cards.data" actions="cards.actions" show-rating="true" pager-id="'demo_one'" options="{ perpage : 2 }" add-title="'Create New Card Pack'"></filamentui-card-container>

Pagination options can be passed in the 'options' attribute, as with tables.
The pager_id attribute is a required attribute.

Cards current support the current types:

<filamentui-card model="unpublishedCard" ng-click="clickMe()" show-rating="false"></filamentui-card>
<filamentui-card model="wDocumentCard" ng-click="clickMe()" show-rating="false"></filamentui-card>
<filamentui-card model="wSentenceCard" ng-click="clickMe()" show-rating="false"></filamentui-card>
<filamentui-card model="wWordCard" ng-click="clickMe()" show-rating="false"></filamentui-card>
<filamentui-card model="addCard" ng-click="clickMe()" show-rating="false"></filamentui-card>
            

        



        
Role Cards

        

        

            
            
            
            
        

        

            
            

                Selected Role Card:
            

            

            

                Role cards are a similar directive to Hub cards.
            

            

                Role cards are expected to used during form layouts where a single option will be chosen by the user out of a pre-defined list of options. Given this, rather than hub cards which allow the developer to pass an action list (to allow each card to have a slightly different action) the role cards will only pipe back a copy of the card model that the user has selected. This allows the form to used the selected data in the desired manner.
            

            

                It is also possible to provide a function via the information attribute. This makes an information icon appear at the top left of the card, and provides another layer of data based on the function attached. An example use would be a popover or modal.
            

            

                With this in mind, role card container does not accept pagination options and should not be used with too many options.
            

            
<filamentui-role-card-container cards="roleCards" ng-model="selectedRoleCard"></filamentui-role-card-container>
            

            

                The following card types are available:
            

            
<filamentui-role-card click="" card="rcUnpublishedModel" style="width: 350px"></filamentui-role-card>
<filamentui-role-card click="" card="rcWordModel" style="width: 350px"></filamentui-role-card>
<filamentui-role-card click="" card="rcDocumentModel" style="width: 350px"></filamentui-role-card>
<filamentui-role-card click="" card="rcSentenceModel" style="width: 350px"></filamentui-role-card>

Progress Bars

        

            

                
                
                
                
                
                
            

        


        

            
<filamentui-progress label="'Static progress'" progress="'50'"></filamentui-progress>
<filamentui-progress label="'Striped, animated progress'" progress="'50'" options="progressOptions"></filamentui-progress>
<filamentui-progress label="'Dynamic progress variable'" progress="progress"></filamentui-progress>
<filamentui-progress label="'Dynamic progress function'" progress="progressFunction()"></filamentui-progress>
<filamentui-progress label="'Static background colour'" progress="progressFunction()" background="'#208040'"></filamentui-progress>
<filamentui-progress label="'Dynamic background colour'" progress="progressFunction()" background="backgroundDynamic"></filamentui-progress>
            


            
Progress bars require label and progress attributes.

            
There is an optional background attribute. This should be a function that will accept the progress (0-100) as a parameter.

            
There is an optional options attribute. This should be an object with stripe and animate as Boolean properties.


            

        

    


    

        
Basic Buttons

        

            

                Primary Button
                Secondary Button
                Back Button
                Info Button
                Delete Button
            


            

                Primary Button
                Secondary Button
                Back Button
                Info Button
                Delete Button
            


            

                
            


            

                Primary Button
                Secondary Button
                Back Button
                Info Button
                Delete Button
            

        


        

            
<filamentui-button class="primary" click="clickMe()" ng-disabled="disableButton()">Primary Button</filamentui-button>

<filamentui-button class="secondary" click="clickMe()" ng-disabled="disableButton()">Secondary Button</filamentui-button>

<filamentui-button class="back" click="clickMe()" ng-disabled="disableButton()">Back Button</filamentui-button>

<filamentui-button class="info" click="clickMe()" ng-disabled="disableButton()">Info Button</filamentui-button>

<filamentui-button class="delete" click="clickMe()" ng-disabled="disableButton()">Delete Button</filamentui-button>
            


            
An optional ng-disabled function can be passed which if returns true will disable the button

            
Passing a click function will determine what action is taken when the button is clicked, and if not disabled.

        

    


    

        
Menu and Plus buttons


        

            

                Select False
                Select True
                Disabled
            


            

                
Single Click Plus Button

                
            


            

                
Left hand-side plus

                
            


            

                
Right hand-side plus

                
            

        


        

            
<filamentui-button class="primary" click="clickMe()" open-on-select-option="false" options="buttonOptions">Primary Button</filamentui-button>


            
The open-on-select-option attribute will determine whether the action chosen in the menu occurs immediately, or if it will only set the action that will occur on 'click' of the main button. Selecting a menu option will always change the main button action.


            
<filamentui-button class="plus" click="clickMe()"></filamentui-button>


            
No menu presented, will only perform the action given by click.


            
<filamentui-button class="plus" options="plusOptions"></filamentui-button>

<filamentui-button class="plus" options="plusOptions" position="'right'"></filamentui-button>
            


            
Plus Buttons with menus will always ignore the open-on-select-option button if passed.


            
Provide position="'right'" if you want the menu to appear fixed to the right hand side of the button, rather than the left.

        

    


    

        
Animated Buttons


        

            Animated Button
            With Options
        


        

            
<filamentui-button class="primary" click="clickMePromise()">Animated Button</filamentui-button>

            
If the click function returns a promise then the button will switch to a loading symbol until the promise is complete

Menu

        

            

                
Left hand-side menu.

                
            

            

                
Right hand-side menu

                
                
Provide 'right' as a position variable if you want the menu to appear fixed to the right hand side of the button, rather than the left.

            

            

                Enabled Delete Menu Items
            

        

        

            
<filamentui-menu options="menu"></filamentui-menu>
            

            
Configures a drop down menu with a set of actions. An example is provided by default. The 'action' method is called when selected and passed the current menu item as a parameter.
            

            
$scope.menu = [
    [
        {
            "title" : "Edit",
            "icon" : "fa-edit",
            "class" : "",
            "action" : function ( item ) {
                alert("clicked on edit\n." + JSON.stringify(item));
            },
        }
    ], [
        {
            "title" : "Delete",
            "icon" : "fa-times",
            "class" : "warning",
            "action" : function ( item ) {
                alert("clicked on edit\n." + JSON.stringify(item));
            },
            "disabled" : function () {
                return !$scope.allowDeleteMenu;
            }
        }
    ]
]
